pullRequest.body:
The meta code was looking for `StrictOrderedSemiring` instead of the weaker `OrderedSemiring` + `Nontrivial`, which is enough.

From LeanAPAP

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [8d8c7cc2c8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17212/commits/8d8c7cc2c8212fb24c5b372c8d4d81760dac62cd)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Rather than having a special ENNReal-ofNat positivity extension, I think we should fix the existing positivity extension for numerals to handle this use case.  Note that currently
```lean
import Mathlib

example : 0 < (2:ENNReal) := by positivity -- fails
example : 0 ‚â§ (2:ENNReal) := by positivity -- works
```
The reason is that in the [tactic code](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/655d653bfd6eb4968829ce8e2b5e4ed0419f6f05/Mathlib/Tactic/Positivity/Core.lean#L185-L196) proving `‚â§` requires `OrderedSemiring` (which holds for ENNReal) but proving `<` requires `StrictOrderedSemiring` (which does not hold for ENNReal).

@YaelDillies I am sure you are very capable of finding or inventing a typeclass which (i) holds for ENNReal and (ii) implies that positive numerals are positive.

Well, that was easy. For some reason I remembered that `Nat.cast_pos` had to use `StrictOrderedSemiring`, but clearly I was wrong *and* short-memoried since no one else than me generalised `Nat.cast_pos` back in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/16172.
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I will try to make the `3 - 2` example work in another PR. Let's keep this one simple.

bors merge
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11169491760/job/31050300141)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11169491760/job/31050299805)
Do you need the `no_index` if you're not using it with `simp`?
Copy pasta :)
I might add a test for \le or \ne as well, but I'll leave it to you whether that's useful
No indeed, positivity already takes care of that
Is it intentional that you're deleting these positivity extensions?
ü§¶ I am incredibly short-sighted today

Could you please add a test like this?
```lean
example : (0 : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû) < 3 - 2 := by positivity
```
(since the `norm_num` positivity extension should handle that too.)

It doesn't work. I suspect it's because `norm_num` doesn't know about truncated subtraction.

Is your "should" meant as in "it should work" or as in "you should make it work"? I think it's pretty out of scope for this PR regardless of your answer.

In fact, my motivation here is to have `positivity` prove that the L2 norm of a nonzero function is positive, and there I really don't have any truncated subtraction
I was operating under the mistaken assumption that `norm_num` reduces `(2:ENNReal) - 1` to `1`.  (It does for Nat but apparently not here.). No action required!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Let `positivity` handle `ENNReal`-valued `ofNat`
